user_stories.title: Define Todo data model and in-memory store
user_stories.description: Create a Todo struct with id (Uuid), title (String), completed (bool), created_at (DateTime). Implement an in-memory store using Arc<RwLock<HashMap>> that supports CRUD operations.
acceptance_criteria: Todo struct is defined with all required fields
TodoStore provides create, read, list, update, delete operations
Unit tests verify all CRUD operations on the store

user_stories.title: Implement REST endpoints for CRUD
user_stories.description: Create axum REST endpoints: POST /todos (create), GET /todos (list all), GET /todos/:id (get one), PUT /todos/:id (update), DELETE /todos/:id (delete). Use proper HTTP status codes.
acceptance_criteria: POST /todos creates a todo and returns 201 with the created todo
GET /todos returns 200 with array of all todos
GET /todos/:id returns 200 with the todo or 404 if not found
PUT /todos/:id returns 200 with updated todo or 404

user_stories.title: Add input validation and error handling
user_stories.description: Validate that todo title is non-empty and under 256 characters. Return structured error responses with consistent JSON format { "error": "message" }. Add request body size limits.
acceptance_criteria: Empty title returns 400 with descriptive error
Unit tests cover validation edge cases

user_stories.title: Add filtering and pagination
user_stories.description: Extend GET /todos to support query parameters: completed (bool filter), limit (default 20, max 100), offset (default 0). Return pagination metadata in response.
acceptance_criteria: Integration tests verify filtering and pagination

technical_requirements: Use Rust with axum, tokio, serde, uuid, chrono
Use proper HTTP status codes throughout
All tests must pass with cargo test
